description:
Bubbles   STATS               
Approximate age        8 years     
Approximate weight               45lbs
Breed (s)           Pit mix
Spayed or neutered? No – to be scheduled
Good with:       
kids?         unknown
strangers?         yes 
other dogs?        no   
cats?        unknown
On leash?            yes
Housetrained?    yes
Crate trained?     yes 
Paper trained?     unknown

Bubbles is looking for a forever home where she can be the center of her family’s attention and get lots of love.

Bubbles needs to have strong, durable chew toys. Bubbles will tear plush toys apart within minutes.

Bubbles is currently being treated for skin issues with medicated baths. Bubbles will be scheduled for mammary mass removal and spay surgery. Simple surgery that the rescue pays for.

Bubbles is a compact snuggle bug who loves attention. Her history is unknown, as she was found tied to a tree in a park in NYC. Bubbles then found herself on the euthanasia list, and became my foster. She will “smile” and wiggle when she is happy. Bubbles loves a warm bath and a peanut butter filled kong. Bubbles loves to wander around her fenced in yard, however, she does well on a leash as well. 

Bubbles knows the command “sit”, and is currently working on “down”, “shake”, and heeling. Bubbles loves all snackies including Dunkin munchkins. Bubbles loves to ride in the car. Bubbles does well in a crate, however, she may tear blankets up. 

While Bubbles has never had an issue with any people she has met, Bubbles does not appear to be a fan of other dogs.

Maple is a mixed breed puppy who will be ready for adoption July 25th. He will be 9 weeks old and have 2 of his 3 required puppy shots. Mom is a pit/ lab mix. Dad is possibly a husky and or Dane but its unsure due to mom at large while in heat. All puppies are fostered in homes with families being socialized, learning house training and crate training. Adoption fee $300 w $50 refund upon proof of spay/ neuter.  Location is near Utica New York 13502. Apply at www.rescuemek9.org

We need a special home for Farrah who was adopted from us as a puppy 11 years ago. She is a beautiful girl who has separation anxiety and would do best in a home where someone is around most of the time, perhaps retired or works from home. She has lived with other dogs and children. If you have room in your home and heart for this https://www.rescuemek9.org/page/page/8245793.htm girl who still has a lot of life to live, and love to give, please apply at She is located near Utica New York. PLEASE SHARE

breeds_label: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler & Carolina Dog Mix
description:
Meet Lindy, a charming 4-month-old female puppy with beautiful facial markings and adorable ears. Lindy is an absolute love bug who is currently in the process of house and crate training. She will bark to let you know when she needs to go out and is not destructive inside or outside. While she does bark because she’s a puppy, it’s not excessive and she can be easily redirected.

Lindy sleeps in her crate with her brother at night and is dog-friendly. We think she could be cat-friendly and would likely do well with kids, although she can be a bit jumpy, as puppies often are. Lindy loves to run and play, and she enjoys being held and snuggled.

We’re working on her leash training, and we believe she could make a great running or hiking partner as she gets older. Although she’s only been in the car once, she did great. Lindy is learning the commands “sit” and “stay,” and she loves treats, toys of all kinds, playing with her brother, and snuggles.

Lindy’s ideal home would be with an active family that has a fenced yard and someone to play with her. She likes to have someone around and enjoys cuddling, being allowed on the furniture, and showing her affectionate side. With her unique looks and loving personality, Lindy is ready to become a cherished member of a loving family.


DISCLAIMER- Breed type is determined based on general appearance and behavioral characteristics and cannot be guaranteed unless DNA test results or AKC registration were provided at intake.

***LINDY IS FOSTERED IN TEXAS, BUT AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION AND TRANSPORT OUT OF STATE. Read below for more information.

Our dogs are transported to a predetermined location agreed upon by the rescue. The adoption contract and fee are finalized prior to transport. As a Pep

Meet Charlie, a 2-year-old American Staffordshire mix with a heart full of love and a spirit that remains unbroken. Weighing in at a perfect 43 pounds, Charlie is the ideal companion for someone looking for a loyal and affectionate friend.
Charlie’s story is one of resilience and unwavering sweetness. Left behind by his previous owners for a month when they moved, he never lost his gentle nature or his hope for a loving home. Despite his rough start, Charlie has shown nothing but pure love and trust to everyone he meets.

With a beautiful, soft white coat and big, soulful eyes, Charlie is not just a sight to behold but a joy to be around. His adorable demeanor and sweet personality make him the perfect cuddle buddy. He thrives on human interaction and is always ready to give and receive affection.

Charlie’s ideal home would be one where he can receive plenty of love and attention. Whether it

re looking for a loyal companion who will shower you with unconditional love, look no further than Charlie.
DISCLAIMER- Breed type is determined based on general appearance and behavioral characteristics and cannot be guaranteed unless DNA test results or AKC registration were provided at intake.

***CHARLIE IS IN TEXAS, BUT AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION AND TRANSPORT OUT OF STATE. Read below for more information.

Our dogs are transported to a predetermined location agreed upon by the rescue. The adoption contract and fee are finalized prior to transport. As a Pep

breeds_label: Labrador Retriever & Black Mouth Cur Mix
description:
Meet Zeke, a 3-year-old, 60 pound bundle of affection who will capture your heart. His joy comes from being close to his human, displaying both exuberant and cuddly moments. Zeke is house and crate trained, responsive to commands like sit & down, and a quick learner eager for treats. While well-behaved, he tends to jump when overly excited and requires ongoing guidance for manners. His favorite place is the couch with his head in your lap, all he wants is to be near his humans!\xa0

Zeke gets along with other dogs and people, and we are unsure of how he does with cats. While likely good with kids, a home with kids over 10 is advised due to his size, as he enjoys running and jumping, potentially knocking over small children.\xa0He loves eating from his big Kong slow feeder bowl. We have worked on his manners and he is going great, but needs reminders.\xa0He is\xa0very smart, loves his kennel,\xa0toys, and treats.\xa0He is not food aggressive with his food toward humans or other dogs.

This playful pup loves chew toys. Harvey sleeps in his kennel at night and when home alone to prevent mischief. Enthusiastic about car rides, he remains curious and adventurous. He even enjoys days at doggy daycare! Rescued from a high-kill shelter in East Texas after his owner died & he was living on a chain 24/7, Zeke has transformed into a confident, happy, and sweet companion. An active household with another dog for him to play with, ideally a fenced yard, and perhaps someone to accompany him on runs, walks, and hikes would be amazing for Zeke. Apartment living would not suit his energetic nature. Zeke is ready for his furever home!\xa0

DISCLAIMER- Breed type is determined based on general appearance and behavioral characteristics and cannot be guaranteed unless DNA test results or AKC registration were provided at intake.

***MOST OF OUR DOGS ARE FOSTERED IN TEXAS, BUT AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION AND TRANSPORT OUT OF STATE. Read below for more information.

Our dogs are transported to a predetermined location agreed upon by the rescue. The adoption contract and fee are finalized prior to transport. As a Pep

breeds_label: Labrador Retriever & American Staffordshire Terrier Mix
description: Meet Presley, an approximately 3-year-old companion who epitomizes the term

Presley is in search of a warm and caring forever home where she can relish in moments of play, affectionate cuddles with her human or furry siblings, and rest easy without the fear of ever being let go, a fate she once experienced with her previous family.

Presley is a devotee of quality time with her human companions, and she adores her walks, exhibiting excellent behavior on the leash with people and not pulling much. She is house and crate trained, and knows the commands
and

In her foster home, she is cat friendly and displays a friendly attitude towards other dogs, even plays with the other dogs\xa0in the yard!\xa0She is not good with chickens, but she is good with tortoises lol! She is dominant, so her ideal future home would be with submissive dogs, as she thrives in an environment where she can take on the alpha role without conflict. Slow, proper introductions to other dogs and cats are crucial! She does constantly yearn to be by her human"s side, but she has grown to truly enjoy being a part of the pack in her foster home and would do so in her forever home as well. While on a leash, Presley exhibits reactivity towards other dogs and animals; however, she responds well to redirection and can be easily guided.

We rescued Presley from a high-risk shelter in Texas just in the nick of time. She was on the brink of being euthanized due to space constraints, especially being the shelter"s longest-standing resident. Her previous owners were contacted, but they showed no interest in reclaiming her or her Husky friend.

Presley"s tale is one of resilience and unwavering loyalty. She longs for her forever family, a loving home where she can be cherished unconditionally. Is there anyone out there willing to provide Presley with the love and care she so rightfully deserves?

DISCLAIMER- Breed type is determined based on general appearance and behavioral characteristics and cannot be guaranteed unless DNA test results or AKC registration were provided at intake.

***PRESLEY IS FOSTERED IN TEXAS, BUT AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION AND TRANSPORT OUT OF STATE. Read below for more information.

Our dogs are transported to a predetermined location agreed upon by the rescue. The adoption contract and fee are finalized prior to transport. As a Pep"s Pals Rescue direct adoption, the adoption interview/meet and greet occurs on video call (Skype, FB Messenger call, Facetime, etc).

Our adoption fee is $350 plus health certificate and transport (varies by location). This fee includes all current vaccinations, deworming, microchip (additional $12.99 registration fee required at time of adoption), fecal analysis, spay/neuter for dogs 6 months & older, and a heartworm test if over 6 months old. All dogs are current on flea/tick and heartworm prevention (she was heartworm positive, but has completed treatment and has since tested negative). A health exam will be completed and a health certificate issued by a veterinarian within 10 days of transport.

If you are interested in adopting, please fill out the adoption application below:
https://petstablished.com/adoption_form/57837/generic
